channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: As Russia threats worsen, all Canadians can help security: Latvian envoy
item.description: 'When Russia is lowering the threshold of doing mischief, using force or anything ... it's very worrying,' said Latvia's ambassador to Canada in an interview with Global News.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Nearly 1 in 10 terrorism investigations at CSIS involves a minor: spy boss
item.description: The head of Canada’s spy agency is warning about a “worrying” number of young people becoming radicalized.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Family of New Brunswick man who died in hospital emergency room settles lawsuit
item.description: The family of a 78-year-old man who died after waiting seven hours for care in a Fredericton hospital has settled a legal action they filed against the province’s health authority.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: NordicTrack rowing machine recalled in Canada over fire hazard
item.description: The company said it has sold 700 units of the rowing machine in Canada. The affected products were sold from November 2018 to April 2022.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: CSIS director outlines security threats posed by Russia, China, Iran, India
item.description: The director of the Canadian Security Intelligence Service catalogued the espionage and transnational repression efforts of Canada’s adversaries.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Governments of Canada and Manitoba Launch Pilot to Reward Sustainable Farming
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Governments Of Canada and Manitoba Strengthening Justice for Canada's First Responders
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: How does this year's flu shot stack up to current strains? What we know
item.description: It's flu season in Canada, and as the number of infections and hospitalizations start to rise, medical experts are urging Canadians to get their flu shots.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: CBSA says airport inspection kiosks working again after outage
item.description: The Canada Border Services Agency says some airport inspection kiosks are currently not working due to an outage for maintenance work.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 60 years later, Nevada homicide victim identified as missing Calgary woman
item.description: Anna Sylvia Just was initially reported missing by her sister after she was last seen boarding a bus in Calgary in 1966. Decades later, her remains have been identified in Nevada.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: B.C. limits when employers can request sick notes
item.description: A government statement says that under new employment standards regulations, an employer can't ask for a note for the first two health-related absences of up to five consecutive days in the same year.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Expands Care for Dialysis Patients and Mothers in Norway House Cree Nation
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canada must not back down on industrial carbon price
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Why Is It So Hard to Fix a Wheelchair in BC?
item.description: Disabled people say companies are struggling to service their equipment, which can trap them in bed or at home.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Why The Tragically Hip are lending their songs to Boi-1da ahead of World Cup | Hanomansing Tonight
item.description: The Tragically Hip have given award-winning producer Boi-1da access to the band's entire catalogue for a special project to raise funds for the Canada Soccer Foundation. Rob Baker, guitarist for the Tragically Hip, discusses more about the project.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: IN PHOTOS | Solar storms bring dazzling display of northern lights
item.description: Solar storms brought colourful auroras to unexpected southern places in Canada and the United States on Tuesday night — and there could be more to come.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Workers ‘needed more' from Budget 2025 amidst trade crisis, Labour Congress says
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Party Discipline Is Undermining Canadian Democracy
item.description: Alberta’s bill ordering teachers back to work is a prime example, say authors of a new book.

item.title: Manitoba Government Recognizes Inaugural Circle of Honour Recipients

item.title: Ontario to spend $210M on non-speed camera road safety measures following ban
item.description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford's government is earmarking $210 million for municipalities to implement traffic-calming measures as its ban on speed cameras is set to take effect.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: How BC Killed the ‘Last Hope’ for the Deaf Community
item.description: A Tyee Q&A with Deaf advocate Sarah-Anne Hrycenko after an NDP retreat on a plan for change.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Third Session of the 43rd Manitoba Legislature to Open Tuesday, Nov. 18 with Speech from the Throne
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘I feel it in my bones': Grey Cup anthem singer brings family legacy to big game
item.description: The national anthem at Sunday's Grey Cup championship in Winnipeg will be performed by Manitoba country singer Catie St. Germain, who says she's nervous but excited.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Art Gallery of Ontario scores major donation of portraits, including Warhol prints
item.description: The Art Gallery of Ontario says it has received a significant gift of more than 450 pieces of art, including works by pop titans Andy Warhol, Roy Lichtenstein and David Hockney.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Slew of recall campaigns in Alberta target UCP politicians

item.description: Robbie Robertson would definitely approve.

item.description: The artist brought the crowd to its feet.

item.title: The Beaches make a play for Canadian rock royalty at Doug Mitchell
item.description: The Beaches are making more than just waves.

item.title: 'Relentless' AFC Toronto set to battle and host 'hard-nosed' Vancouver Rise FC in 1st NSL Final
item.description: The first Northern Super League Final will never be forgotten, regardless of Saturday's outcome. But it could be more memorable if host AFC Toronto and Vancouver Rise FC match the excitement of their respective paths to the Canadian professional women's soccer championship.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Historic Stampede Ranch once owned by outdoor show's founder facing receivership application hearing
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ottawa seeking a permanent parliamentary budget officer with 'tact and discretion'
item.description: Ottawa says it's looking to hire a permanent parliamentary budget officer — someone with "tact and discretion" — just a few months after appointing a critical fiscal watchdog on an interim basis.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: N.W.T. residential school grave exhumed, child's remains repatriated to family
item.description: The grave of a residential school victim was exhumed, and the child's remains were returned to her home community. Five-year-old Alma Beaulieu died at St Joseph's school in 1944.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Federal budget cuts $2.7 billion in international assistance
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The Alluring Mysteries of BC’s Humpback Whales
item.description: As their numbers grow, so do deadly human encounters. Researchers are fascinated by their songs, sexuality and collective creativity.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Is there any point in getting a flu shot that's mismatched to the virus? Here’s what the science says
item.description: Some scientists say this year's flu shot isn't well matched to a key strain that could spread widely in the months ahead. So, is there still a point in getting it? Medical experts say: absolutely. Here’s why.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator
